result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan D. SHARLEIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Michael Gadzinski and Gianni Smith.  

Continue with current mental health treatment.  

Submit DNA sample and pay costs.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed, to be imposed upon the agents discretion.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law, on count 2 only.

Additional thirty-nine (39) days in the county jail, under the Huber Law, on count 2 only, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

(LIBERTAS TREATMENT RECORDS ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT ON 01-27-15)

State files an Amended Information charging 1 ct. Burglary, contrary to Section 943.10(2)(e); 1 ct. Disorderly conduct, contrary to Section 947.01(1); 1 ct. Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, contrary to Section 943.14.  
No contest pleas to all the charges.  Court enters convictions on Count 2, disorderly conduct and Count 3, criminal trespass to dwelling.  As to count 1, Court withholds entry of judgment.  
Sentencing hearing set for 01-27-15 at 3:00 p.m.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.  
Notice.
Minutes.

Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Counsel.  
It is hereby ordered as follows:  
1.  That Attorney Michael E. Lambert shall be hereby substituted as attorney for the defendant, Jordan D. Sharlein, in the above captioned action; and
2.  That Attorney Adam Snavely shall hereby deliver the files and records in his possession regarding this action to Attorney Michael E. Lambert.
Plea date is reset to 12-30-14 at 11:00 a.m.
Plea hearing is set for 12-01-14 at 4:00 p.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 10-31-14 at 9:00 a.m.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-10-14 at 1:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-20-14 at 2:15 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Courtney Livingood, on 07-26-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of burglary and false imprisonment.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-11-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash  with the conditions that he maintain absolute sobriety and have no contact with Courtney Livingood or her residence at 2606 14th Street, Upper, Two Rivers, WI and no contact with Michael Gadzinski and J.M.S., DOB:09-04-1997.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.
Minutes.
